alert.note: Alert for Barry; McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 23 at 9:51PM CDT until March 24 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Barry County in southwestern Missouri... Southeastern McDonald County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 400 AM CDT Friday. * At 951 PM CDT, gauge reports indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cassville, Pineville, Noel, Purdy, Seligman, Exeter, Wheaton, Washburn, Shell Knob, Butterfield, Wayne, Ridgley, Mcdowell, Powell, Jenkins, Madry, Wheelerville, Roaring River State Park and Big Sugar Creek State Park. This includes the following low water crossings... Mikes Creek at Highway U, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Flat Creek at Highway U, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, Flat Creek at Highway C and Bentonville Hollow at Highway E. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
